page.title: 20THE BLIND ARTIST
page.content: Losing one sense,sight, Carolyn James had to begin anew.Now she uses her memory and her hearing.Her paintings have been exhibited most recently in Edinburgh and in Livingstone,near Edinburgh.Her painting is more of a career not a hobby. In her mind's eye she sees pictures which she transfers onto paper,first of all covering it with a wash,blue for water and sky or green for meadows and trees.On this she paints details as she imagines them using paints arranged in a sequence which she remembers;only once has she made a mistake in which she painted the sky brown! Carolyn also writes lyrics.On Sunday 16June,on ITV's Highway Moira Anderson will sing one of her ballads;Sir Harry Secombe,Dana and Ian Wallace are to sing others on TV and record.
